name: What Characters! Part Deux Trivia Game | Name the Movie | 10 Questions

questions.text: The character menu for this movie of the 2000s includes Maximus, Proximo and the stoic Roman emperor Marcus Aurelius.  Which exciting film fits this description?
questions.explanation:
Gladiator.

	'Gladiator' is the story of a Roman general named Maximus (Russell Crowe) who serves admirably at the pleasure of Emperor Marcus Aurelius (Richard Harris).  However, upon the death of the stalwart emperor, Maximus is betrayed, eventually finding himself in the service of Proximo (Oliver Reed), master of a group of Gladiators.

questions.text: From all the way back in 1940 comes a beautifully scripted film featuring characters named Tom Joad, Rose-of-Sharon Rivers and Casy, a preacher.  In which classic oldie do these individuals appear?
questions.explanation:
The Grapes of Wrath.

	Tom Joad (Henry Fonda), Rose-of-Sharon (Dorris Bowdon), Casy (John Carradine) and the rest of the Joad clan are among the thousands of Midwesterners who come to California, during the darkest days of the Great Depression, in search of work.  Good performances are put in by all in this Academy Award-winner by director John Ford.

questions.text: Pike Bishop, Dutch Engstrom and Freddie Sykes are among the individuals who make up a grouping of men who form which of these 1960s film titles?
questions.explanation:
The Wild Bunch.

	William Holden is Pike Bishop, leader of the Wild Bunch.  Ernest Borgnine is Dutch Engstrom, Bishop's right hand man.  Edmund O'Brien is magnificent as Freddie Sykes, the man who provides the getaway transportation for the gang.  Sam Peckinpah directs this film about a group of outlaws who attempt one last robbery before calling it quits.

questions.text: Which one of these films, from the heyday of Hollywood epics, features such characters as Marcus Licinius Crassus, Varinia and Lentulus Batiatus?
questions.explanation:
Spartacus.

	Laurence Olivier deftly plays the domineering Crassus, a Roman general who challenges the slave revolt started by his nemesis Spartacus (Kirk Douglas).  Varinia (Jean Simmons) is a slave girl who, though originally in the hands of the obsequious Lentulus Batiatus (Oscar winner Peter Ustinov), comes to fall in love with fellow slave Spartacus.

questions.text: Okay folks, here's a breather.  Which 1970s film featured such obscure characters as Han Solo, Luke Skywalker and Princess Leia Organa?
questions.explanation:
Star Wars.

	'Star Wars' is a story that takes place an extraordinary length of time in the very distant past. It's in a galaxy whose distance, as calculated from Earth, exceeds any length that individuals such as ourselves could possibly imagine.  Oh yeah, and in the film two chaps named Han Solo (Harrison Ford) and Luke Skywalker (Mark Hamill) seek to rescue the captured Princess Leia (Carrie Fisher) from the evil clutches of the malevolent Darth Vader.

questions.text: Cue the surfing music!  Which very popular 1990s movie featured characters with quirky names like Vincent Vega, Butch Coolidge and Marsellus Wallace?
questions.explanation:
Pulp Fiction.

	'Pulp Fiction' is a veritable pastiche of stories and characters, interwoven masterfully by pop-icon/director Quentin Tarantino.  The film finds focus with several important characters, namely Vincent Vega (John Travolta), a hit man working for a certain Marsellus Wallace (Ving Rhames). Butch Coolidge (Bruce Willis) is a nearly washed out boxer, who is paid to fix a fight by this self-same Mr. Wallace.  When things go slightly awry with the plan, crazy fireworks ensue between the above-mentioned individuals.

questions.text: To understand the important characters from this film of the 1960s, you need know only three names: Blondie, Angel Eyes and Tuco.  What is the title of the film masterpiece that involves these three tough guys?
questions.correct: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
questions.explanation:
The Good, the Bad and the Ugly.

	Just as the title suggests, there are three forces at work in this film, the 'Good', represented by Clint Eastwood, aka Blondie, the 'Bad', portrayed accurately by Lee Van Cleef, aka Angel Eyes, and the 'Ugly', a character of questionable values named Tuco, played to great comic effect by Eli Wallach.  The film involves the interactions among these three characters, each of whom single-mindedly pursues a large cache of gold hidden in a secret location.

questions.text: We only know the actual names of two of the characters from this film, namely Mr. Davis and Mr. McCardle.  Otherwise they are known as Juror #8 and Juror #9.  Heck, let's toss in Juror #3 to make it an even three of the main characters in which classic courtroom drama?
questions.explanation:
12 Angry Men.

	'12 Angry Men' is the story of 12 jurors who have been selected to decide on what seems like an open and shut case.  But wait, Juror #8 (Henry Fonda) goes and throws a monkey wrench in the works by considering the possibility of reasonable doubt.  Beginning with Juror #9 (Joseph Sweeney), he tries to convince each juror, one by one, that the young man on trial may not have the word 'guilty' stamped across his forehead. In the end, even the most stubborn jurors, for example Juror #3 (Lee J. Cobb) are forced to confront the possibility that Juror #8 is correct.  By the way, at the very end of the film we learn the surnames of jurors eight and nine.

questions.text: Marla Singer, Tyler Durden and Robert Paulson are some of the key characters that populate which iconic film of the modern culture of angst?
questions.explanation:
Fight Club.

	'Fight Club' is the story about a frustrated company man who suddenly finds himself as the leader of a subversive group of individuals attempting to tear down the fabric of modern society.  Tyler Durden (Brad Pitt) is a mysterious and carefree chap who befriends the narrator (played by Ed Norton), while Marla Singer (Helena Bonham Carter) plays his lady interest.  Robert Paulson (Meatloaf) is one of the first recruits in 'Project Mayhem'.

questions.text: Alexander de Large is the main character and Georgie and Dim are supporting characters in which dystopic 1970s film about a violent subculture, replete with problems related to sex and drugs?
options: One Flew over the Cuckoo's Nest
questions.explanation:
A Clockwork Orange.

	Malcolm MacDowell, as Alexander de Large, is a lawless youth whose only pleasures come from subverting society in every way he sees fit.  Georgie (James Marcus) and Dim (Warren Clarke) are Alex's erstwhile friends and followers (aka Droogs) who eventually overthrow their malevolent leader.  This frightening dark comedy is brilliantly directed by Stanley Kubrick. Thanks for trying this quiz, I hope you have enjoyed it.
